result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashied M. Pritchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rashied M. Pritchett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rashied M. Pritchett was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Rashied M. Pritchett was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Rashied M. Pritchett was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $30.00 (to Mr.Kim) plus surcharges; jointly & severally with Frank Mosley.  Restitution may be amended to include restitution from Robert Kavalauskas.
May not have contact with Victims.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  While on probation, DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

Ct 1 - deft sentenced to 9-1/2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 42mos followed by 6yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 286 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP & SAP.

Cts 2 & 3 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 8yrs on each count concurrent but consecutive to count 1.  See conditions.  

Restitution ordered in the amount of $30 to Mr. Kim.  NOTE - deft informed by the Court that the restitution may be amended to include a claim from R.K.  
Appeal rights.
Firearm Warning
Voting acknowledgment
DNA ordered; notice given to deft
Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 11:30 am.
sentencing hrg for today to be rescheduled; defense counsel out for medical reasons
Defense counsel out ill - sentencing hrg adj to 4/18/16 @ 3:30pm.  Email sent to attys
Sentencing hrg moved from 4/8 to 4/11/16 @ 3:30pm on request of defense counsel.  No objection by the State.  Email sent to attys

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Defense requests an adjournment; Atty Rufo needs time to review the balance of the PSI with the deft.  Sentencing hrg adjourned to 4/8/16 @ 9:30am.  Atty Rufo notes for the record that the deft is no longer requesting new counsel.
from deft; copy sent to attys 3/15/16

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 2, & 3; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/31/16 @ 2pm.  Count 4 is dismissed on State's motion.
Plea hearing at 02-26-2016 09:30 am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Andrea Rufo.  Atty Rufo requests the trial date be changed into a plea date.  The case is resolved, but she was unable to meet w/her client this morning to complete the necessary paperwork since he was already in transit for this hrg from KCDC.  Plea hrg set for 2/15/16 @ 2:15pm.
